required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Influence of Running and Velocity to Kinematic Parameters
clinical_study.official_title: The Influence of Running and Velocity to Kinematic Parameters

lead_sponsor.agency: Guangzhou General Hospital of Guangzhou Military Command

collaborator.agency: Medical Center of Assessment, Prevention and Treatment of Bone & Joint Diseases, Guangdong, China
The First Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University

clinical_study.source: Guangzhou General Hospital of Guangzhou Military Command

brief_summary.textblock: Some researches have found that gait posture velocity have influence on kinematic parameters. However, how the gait velocity and posture will influence kinematic parameters remain unclear. In addition to walking, running is one of the most daily activities of people. The purpose of this research is to find out the influence of gait velocity and running to kinematic parameters . To do this, it will provide a reference for future prospective studies or investigations and make us fully understand the impact of gait velocity and running to kinematic parameters of gait.

primary_outcome.measure: Kinematic characteristics of the the six-degree-of-motion (6DOF) of the gait at initial contact.
primary_outcome.description: The 6DOF include flexion/extension, internal/external rotation, varus/valgus, anterior/posterior translation, medial/ lateral translation, proximal/distal translation.

primary_outcome.measure: Kinematic characteristics of the the six-degree-of-motion (6DOF) of the gait at loading response.
primary_outcome.description: The 6DOF include flexion/extension, internal/external rotation, varus/valgus, anterior/posterior translation, medial/ lateral translation, proximal/distal translation.

primary_outcome.measure: Kinematic characteristics of the the six-degree-of-motion (6DOF) of the gait at mid-stance.
primary_outcome.description: The 6DOF include flexion/extension, internal/external rotation, varus/valgus, anterior/posterior translation, medial/ lateral translation, proximal/distal translation.

primary_outcome.measure: Kinematic characteristics of the the six-degree-of-motion (6DOF) of the gait at terminal stance.
primary_outcome.description: The 6DOF include flexion/extension, internal/external rotation, varus/valgus, anterior/posterior translation, medial/ lateral translation, proximal/distal translation.

primary_outcome.measure: Kinematic characteristics of the the six-degree-of-motion (6DOF) of the gait at initial swing.
primary_outcome.description: The 6DOF include flexion/extension, internal/external rotation, varus/valgus, anterior/posterior translation, medial/ lateral translation, proximal/distal translation.

primary_outcome.measure: Kinematic characteristics of the the six-degree-of-motion (6DOF) of the gait at mid-swing.
primary_outcome.description: The 6DOF include flexion/extension, internal/external rotation, varus/valgus, anterior/posterior translation, medial/ lateral translation, proximal/distal translation.

primary_outcome.measure: Kinematic characteristics of the the six-degree-of-motion (6DOF) of the gait at terminal swing.
primary_outcome.description: The 6DOF include flexion/extension, internal/external rotation, varus/valgus, anterior/posterior translation, medial/ lateral translation, proximal/distal translation.

primary_outcome.measure: The ranges of motion in the the six-degree-of-motion (6DOF) of the gait.
primary_outcome.description: The 6DOF include flexion/extension, internal/external rotation, varus/valgus, anterior/posterior translation, medial/ lateral translation, proximal/distal translation.

arm_group.description: The condition of this group will be set as participants walking at 3.5km/h
The condition of this group will be set as participants walking at 4.0km/h
The condition of this group will be set as participants running at 3.5km/h
The condition of this group will be set as participants running at 4.0km/h

intervention.description: Once participants are eligible, they will undergo the experimental procedure. Before data collection, they will walk or run on a treadmill in barefoot for ten minutes to adapt the condition. The a gait analysis system will collect the data while they walk or run on the treadmill in barefoot at selected gait speed.

study_pop.textblock: All the participants will be recruited via university advertisement.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
i) 20< age < 30. ii) Body mass index < 30. iii) No history of major injury or surgery in lower limbs. iv) No symptoms of lower limbs. v) Physical examination to test the lower limbs to be normal. vi) The habit of moderate exercise (e.g. Jogging )at least once a week for at least 30 minutes
Exclusion Criteria:
i)Body mass index >30. ii) Injury or surgery in hip/knee/ankle. iii) History trauma in the lower limbs (e.g. fracture). iv) Neuropathic disease . v) Muscular disease. vi) Lack ability to finish the procedure physically or mentally. vii) Easy to fall. viii) Any other conditions that can influence gait parameters of the lower limbs.

overall_official.affiliation: Hospital of Orthopedics, Guangzhou General Hospital of Guangzhou Military Command, 111 Liuhua Road, Guangzhou 510010, China

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Guangzhou General Hospital of Guangzhou Military Command
